text: In the current study , we examined the effects of the cell cycle status on EV - D68 viral replication , as well as the impact of EV - D68 virus on the host cell cycle . Our data show that EV - D68 replication is integrally associated with the host cell cycle , though the pattern of regulation differs distinctly from that of EV - A71 . These results further increase the understanding of the pathogenic mechanisms of enteroviruses and provide a potential target for the treatment and prevention of enterovirus - related diseases .
